title: A conscionable couple, or, The valiant resolution of a young-man and a maid, that have left all their kindred, as true folks have said: twas for their religion and good conscience sake, that they forsook England, a voyage to take. These two loving Protestants kindly together, are gone to seek fortunes, there's no man knows whither. To a curious new tune, or, The faithful friend.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, J. Wright, and J. Clark.,
